derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: probably an alteration of obsolete windas, via Anglo-Norman French from Old Norse vindáss, literally 'winding pole'

entry.def: A windlass is a mechanical device for lifting heavy objects, which uses a motor to pull a rope or chain around a cylinder.

means.word_mean: 1. lifting device consisting of a horizontal cylinder turned by a crank on which a cable or rope winds
